articles.title: President Biden Evacuated After Plane Entered Airspace Near Delaware Beach Home
articles.description: A small private airplane mistakenly entered restricted airspace near President Joe Biden's Delaware vacation home Saturday, prompting the brief evacuation of the president and first lady, the White House and the Secret Service said.

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Fifth Victim Found in Train Wreckage in Germany
articles.description: Police said Saturday the body of a fifth victim has been been found beneath a train that derailed Friday in the Alps in southern Germany.
articles.content:
FRANKFURT, Germany — Police said Saturday the body of a fifth victim has been been found beneath a train that derailed Friday in the Alps in southern Germany.

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Original Gerber Baby Ann Turner Cook Dies at 95
articles.description: Ann Turner Cook, whose cherubic baby face was known the world over as the original Gerber baby, has died. She was 95.
articles.content:
TAMPA, Fla. — Ann Turner Cook, whose cherubic baby face was known the world over as the original Gerber baby, has died. She was 95.
Gerber announced Cook’s passing in an Instagram post on Friday.

articles.title: Abbott Restarts Baby Formula Plant Linked to Contamination
articles.description: Abbott Nutrition has restarted production at the Michigan baby formula factory that has been closed for months due to contamination, the company said Saturday, taking a step toward easing a nationwide supply shortage expected to persist into the summer.

articles.title: Iga Swiatek Beats Coco Gauff for Second French Open Title
articles.description: Top-ranked Iga Swiatek beat 18-year-old American Coco Gauff 6-1, 6-3 in the French Open women’s final Saturday to collect her second title at Roland Garros and stretch her winning streak to 35 matches.
